title: Lao people
summary: The Lao people are a Tai ethnic group native to Southeast Asia, who speak the eponymous language of the Kraâ€“Dai languages, originating from present-day southern China. They are the majority ethnic group of Laos, making up 53.2% of the total population. The majority of Lao people adhere to Theravada Buddhism. They are closely related to other Tai peoples, especially (or synonymous) with the Isan people, who are also speakers of Lao language, but native to neighboring Thailand.
